40 enum class TriangleRaycastSide {
41 
43  FRONT,
44 
46  BACK,
47 
49  FRONT_AND_BACK
50 };
51 
52 // Class TriangleShape
60 class TriangleShape : public ConvexPolyhedronShape {
61 
62  protected:
63 
64  // -------------------- Attribute -------------------- //
65 
66 
68  Vector3 mPoints[3];
69 
71  Vector3 mNormal;
72 
74  Vector3 mVerticesNormals[3];
75 
77  TriangleRaycastSide mRaycastTestType;
78 
80  HalfEdgeStructure& mTriangleHalfEdgeStructure;
81 
82  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
83 
85  virtual Vector3 getLocalSupportPointWithoutMargin(const Vector3& direction) const override;
86 
88  Vector3 computeSmoothLocalContactNormalForTriangle(const Vector3& localContactPoint) const;
89 
91  virtual bool testPointInside(const Vector3& localPoint, Collider* collider) const override;
92 
94  virtual bool raycast(const Ray& ray, RaycastInfo& raycastInfo, Collider* collider, MemoryAllocator& allocator) const override;
95 
97  virtual size_t getSizeInBytes() const override;
98 
100  void generateId();
101 
102  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
103 
105  void computeSmoothMeshContact(Vector3 localContactPointTriangle, const Transform& triangleShapeToWorldTransform,
106  const Transform& worldToOtherShapeTransform, decimal penetrationDepth, bool isTriangleShape1,
107  Vector3& outNewLocalContactPointOtherShape, Vector3& outSmoothWorldContactTriangleNormal) const;
108 
110  TriangleShape(const Vector3* vertices, const Vector3* verticesNormals, uint32 shapeId, HalfEdgeStructure& triangleHalfEdgeStructure,
111  MemoryAllocator& allocator);
112 
114  TriangleShape(const Vector3* vertices, uint32 shapeId, HalfEdgeStructure& triangleHalfEdgeStructure, MemoryAllocator& allocator);
115 
117  virtual ~TriangleShape() override = default;
118 
119  public:

176  Vector3& localContactPointShape1, Vector3& localContactPointShape2,
177  const Transform& shape1ToWorld, const Transform& shape2ToWorld,
178  decimal penetrationDepth, Vector3& outSmoothVertexNormal);
179 
181  virtual std::string to_string() const override;

191 
192 // Return the number of bytes used by the collision shape
193 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE size_t TriangleShape::getSizeInBytes() const {
194  return sizeof(TriangleShape);
195 }
196 
197 // Return a local support point in a given direction without the object margin
198 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::getLocalSupportPointWithoutMargin(const Vector3& direction) const {
199  Vector3 dotProducts(direction.dot(mPoints[0]), direction.dot(mPoints[1]), direction.dot(mPoints[2]));
200  return mPoints[dotProducts.getMaxAxis()];
201 }
202 
203 // Return the local bounds of the shape in x, y and z directions.
204 // This method is used to compute the AABB of the box
209 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void TriangleShape::getLocalBounds(Vector3& min, Vector3& max) const {
210 
211  const Vector3 xAxis(mPoints[0].x, mPoints[1].x, mPoints[2].x);
212  const Vector3 yAxis(mPoints[0].y, mPoints[1].y, mPoints[2].y);
213  const Vector3 zAxis(mPoints[0].z, mPoints[1].z, mPoints[2].z);
214  min.setAllValues(xAxis.getMinValue(), yAxis.getMinValue(), zAxis.getMinValue());
215  max.setAllValues(xAxis.getMaxValue(), yAxis.getMaxValue(), zAxis.getMaxValue());
216 
217  min -= Vector3(mMargin, mMargin, mMargin);
218  max += Vector3(mMargin, mMargin, mMargin);
219 }
220 
221 // Return the local inertia tensor of the triangle shape
227 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::getLocalInertiaTensor(decimal /*mass*/) const {
228  return Vector3(0, 0, 0);
229 }
230 
231 // Return true if a point is inside the collision shape
232 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool TriangleShape::testPointInside(const Vector3& /*localPoint*/, Collider* /*collider*/) const {
233  return false;
234 }
235 
236 // Return the number of faces of the polyhedron
237 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE uint32 TriangleShape::getNbFaces() const {
238  return 2;
239 }
240 
241 // Return the number of vertices of the polyhedron
242 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE uint32 TriangleShape::getNbVertices() const {
243  return 3;
244 }
245 
246 // Return a given vertex of the polyhedron
247 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const HalfEdgeStructure::Vertex& TriangleShape::getVertex(uint32 vertexIndex) const {
248  assert(vertexIndex < 3);
249  return mTriangleHalfEdgeStructure.getVertex(vertexIndex);
250 }
251 
252 // Return the position of a given vertex
253 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::getVertexPosition(uint32 vertexIndex) const {
254  assert(vertexIndex < 3);
255  return mPoints[vertexIndex];
256 }
257 
258 // Return the normal vector of a given face of the polyhedron
259 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::getFaceNormal(uint32 faceIndex) const {
260  assert(faceIndex < 2);
261  assert(mNormal.length() > decimal(0.0));
262  return faceIndex == 0 ? mNormal : -mNormal;
263 }
264 
265 // Return the centroid of the box
266 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::getCentroid() const {
267  return (mPoints[0] + mPoints[1] + mPoints[2]) / decimal(3.0);
268 }
269 
270 // Return the number of half-edges of the polyhedron
271 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE uint32 TriangleShape::getNbHalfEdges() const {
272  return 6;
273 }
274 
275 // Return the raycast test type (front, back, front-back)
276 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE TriangleRaycastSide TriangleShape::getRaycastTestType() const {
277  return mRaycastTestType;
278 }
279 
280 // Set the raycast test type (front, back, front-back)
284 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void TriangleShape::setRaycastTestType(TriangleRaycastSide testType) {
285  mRaycastTestType = testType;
286 }
287 
288 // Return the string representation of the shape
289 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE std::string TriangleShape::to_string() const {
290  return "TriangleShape{v1=" + mPoints[0].to_string() + ", v2=" + mPoints[1].to_string() + "," +
291  "v3=" + mPoints[2].to_string() + "}";
292 }
293 
294 // Compute and return the volume of the collision shape
295 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal TriangleShape::getVolume() const {
296  return decimal(0.0);
297 }
298 
299 // Get a smooth contact normal for collision for a triangle of the mesh
309 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 TriangleShape::computeSmoothLocalContactNormalForTriangle(const Vector3& localContactPoint) const {
310 
311  assert(mNormal.length() > decimal(0.0));
312 
313  // Compute the barycentric coordinates of the point in the triangle
314  decimal u, v, w;
315  computeBarycentricCoordinatesInTriangle(mPoints[0], mPoints[1], mPoints[2], localContactPoint, u, v, w);
316 
317  // If the contact is in the middle of the triangle face (not on the edges)
318  if (u > MACHINE_EPSILON && v > MACHINE_EPSILON && w > MACHINE_EPSILON) {
319 
320  // We return the true triangle face normal (not the interpolated one)
321  return mNormal;
322  }
323 
324  // We compute the contact normal as the barycentric interpolation of the three vertices normals
325  const Vector3 interpolatedNormal = u * mVerticesNormals[0] + v * mVerticesNormals[1] + w * mVerticesNormals[2];
326 
327  // If the interpolated normal is degenerated
328  if (interpolatedNormal.lengthSquare() < MACHINE_EPSILON) {
329 
330  // Return the original normal
331  return mNormal;
332  }
333 
334  return interpolatedNormal.getUnit();
335 }
336 
337 // This method compute the smooth mesh contact with a triangle in case one of the two collision
338 // shapes is a triangle. The idea in this case is to use a smooth vertex normal of the triangle mesh
339 // at the contact point instead of the triangle normal to avoid the internal edge collision issue.
340 // This method will return the new smooth world contact
341 // normal of the triangle and the the local contact point on the other shape.
342 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void TriangleShape::computeSmoothTriangleMeshContact(const CollisionShape* shape1, const CollisionShape* shape2,
343  Vector3& localContactPointShape1, Vector3& localContactPointShape2,
344  const Transform& shape1ToWorld, const Transform& shape2ToWorld,
345  decimal penetrationDepth, Vector3& outSmoothVertexNormal) {
346 
347  assert(shape1->getName() != CollisionShapeName::TRIANGLE || shape2->getName() != CollisionShapeName::TRIANGLE);
348 
349  // If one the shape is a triangle
350  bool isShape1Triangle = shape1->getName() == CollisionShapeName::TRIANGLE;
351  if (isShape1Triangle || shape2->getName() == CollisionShapeName::TRIANGLE) {
352 
353  const TriangleShape* triangleShape = isShape1Triangle ? static_cast<const TriangleShape*>(shape1):
354  static_cast<const TriangleShape*>(shape2);
355 
356  // Compute the smooth triangle mesh contact normal and recompute the local contact point on the other shape
357  triangleShape->computeSmoothMeshContact(isShape1Triangle ? localContactPointShape1 : localContactPointShape2,
358  isShape1Triangle ? shape1ToWorld : shape2ToWorld,
359  isShape1Triangle ? shape2ToWorld.getInverse() : shape1ToWorld.getInverse(),
360  penetrationDepth, isShape1Triangle,
361  isShape1Triangle ? localContactPointShape2 : localContactPointShape1,
362  outSmoothVertexNormal);
363  }
364 }
365 
366 // Return a given face of the polyhedron
367 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const HalfEdgeStructure::Face& TriangleShape::getFace(uint32 faceIndex) const {
368  assert(faceIndex < 2);
369  return mTriangleHalfEdgeStructure.getFace(faceIndex);
370 }
371 
372 // Return a given half-edge of the polyhedron
373 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const HalfEdgeStructure::Edge& TriangleShape::getHalfEdge(uint32 edgeIndex) const {
374  assert(edgeIndex < getNbHalfEdges());
375  return mTriangleHalfEdgeStructure.getHalfEdge(edgeIndex);
376 }
377 
378 }
379 
380 #endif
